runs.comm: back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
a bit fuller, seemed to fall away in his action a little bit, and the angle takes the ball too far down the leg side
short and wide, and Rohit helps himself, just shows the ball a horizontal bat-face and sends it screaming to the backward point boundary
back of a length, a bit of width again, punched firmly and Behaardien dives left to make the stop at point
slower ball, almost up in the blockhole on an off-stump line, Dhawan jams down from that high backlift to keep it out

length ball, a bit of inward movement to cramp Dhawan and hit him on the pad as he looks to squirt it away through the leg side. Impact well outside leg stump. The ball ricocheted into the off side and Rohit took off from the non-striker's end. Dhawan sent him back, and the throw from Faf hit Rohit on the elbow just as he was getting back into his crease.
length ball, close to off stump. Dhawan presses forward and pushes to cover
slider first up, skids on towards middle stump. Rohit, pressing forward, tucks it cautiously to midwicket
looks to fire this in quick and straight and hurry Rohit. Manages that, but also slides down the leg side

whoa. The ball hit his elbow in the previous over. Now this one jumps up off a crack, just short of good length, maybe, and knocks the bat out of his startled hands as he looked to work it into the leg side
fuller, tucked past midwicket

slower now, slides on with the arm and goes away from Dhawan with the angle. Was looking to stay leg side of the ball and hit through the covers, ends up getting a thick edge past the keeper, flies to the third man boundary
length ball on off stump, poked to cover off the back foot
quick and flat down the leg side, Dhawan can't get bat to his attempted reverse-sweep. Looks puzzled that it wasn't called wide
back of a length, skids in towards middle stump. Rohit tucks it away into the leg side, backward of square
full on off stump, driven past the diving extra cover fielder, who might have got a hand on it to slow it down and make it easier for the man chasing to his right from mid-off
whoa. That was some bounce. Banged the pitch hard, got up to head height while also angling into the batsman, forcing Rohit to sway his head hurriedly out of the way
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Good bounce again, and Rohit gets on his toes, allows the ball to come to him, and dabs it with soft hands towards backward point
length ball, Dhawan premeditatedly steps down the pitch. The ball comes into him, cramps him for room, and he inside-edges into his pad while looking to drive through mid-off
length ball on middle and off, stays leg-side of the ball and pushes it to the right of mid-off
starts with a full one close to off stump. Dhawan looks to drive through cover, ends up inside-edging into his pad. Not for the first time
angled into the pads, tucked away towards Rabada, who misfields at short fine leg
on the pads once more, full, and Rohit accepts the freebie gleefully, flicks it away fine, a long way to the right of short fine leg
length ball on middle stump, pushed softly towards mid-on for the quick single
short, just a bit of width, and that's all Dhawan needs. Stands tall and cuts hard, and even though Behaardien got a hand to it while diving to his right at point, he couldn't stop the boundary

full and straight, and it hits Dhawan on the pad as he looks to whip it across the line. Umpire raised his finger as soon as Morris turned around to appeal. We'll have to see where that pitched and where it was headed. Looked out at first glance, looked like it straightened a touch. Pitched on leg and middle, straightened a touch. Enough to hit off stump?
short, rising ball outside off, dabbed away to third man

full-toss on middle and off, worked away towards deep midwicket, and he's run out first ball! He walks off cursing himself (or maybe Rohit - not sure who called for the second run). Throw came in nice and flat and AB had the bails off in a flash, with Kohli a good foot out. Yup. It was Rohit who called. Kohli didn't run the first run all that quick. Morris was the fielder. He had to run a fair distance towards his left.
length ball on middle and off, clipped gently to the left of mid-on
short outside off, lots of bounce, dabbed away with an open face towards third man
length ball on off stump, defended into the cover region
fullish outside off, angling away from Raina, who leaves it alone
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
shortens his length a touch, gets it to come in towards off stump. Rohit, who's pressed forward early, lets it come on and drops it down with soft hands towards backward point
full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man

whoa, that's some serious pace and lift. Wasn't too far short of a good length, and Rohit's weight may have been on the front foot. Looked to play it to third man with an open face and the ball simply zipped past his edge and the keeper took it over his head
full on middle stump, clipped wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump. Rohit uses the angle and tucks it softly into the on side
short ball, and Raina shuffles across, plays an unconvincing-looking pull, and top-edges it loopily, too far to the right of the keeper to catch it on the dive
slower ball, full-toss on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
another bouncer that forces AB to leap and grab the ball overhead - one-handed this time - but it starts well down the leg side
slower ball, shortish, tucked off the hips to the right of long leg

big appeal for caught behind. It was very full, and I'm surprised it didn't bowl Raina around his legs. He walked across to play it on the leg side, missed. AB dived to his right to catch it, and appealed immediately. There was a click as it went past. Not sure if it was bat or Raina's back heel. It was the heel - that's where the Snicko spike happened
length ball on off stump, blocked to mid-off
starts with a short ball that rises sharply and tucks up Rohit for room. Sways his body out of the way and helps it towards third man
back of a length, angling across, steers it away behind point with an open face
a bit of extra bounce again, fifth-stump line. Rohit was looking to play it to third man again, and the ball slid quickly past his open face
length ball outside off, slapped firmly to extra cover. Ball didn't come on as well as he would have liked

back of a length outside off, lets it come on and pushes it to the right of point. Takes off for a single, takes on David Miller's arm, and he's a goner - the direct hit at the bowler's end finds him a foot short. Brilliant fielding, capitalising on the fact that Rohit was starting from deep in the crease, having played that ball off the back foot
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg
back of a length, angling away from off stump, steered down to third man
full outside off, driven to extra cover

oh my. That's a full-toss, and Rayudu swings across the line, loses his shape, and loses his leg stump. Not the greatest delivery Rabada has bowled in his life, and definitely not the greatest shot Rayudu has played in his life
length ball, fifth-stump line, Dhoni leaves it alone
short, angling down the leg side, and Dhoni shuffles helpfully out of the way
back of a length outside off, pushed off the back foot to backward point
another short ball down the leg side, and this one rises steeply and forces AB to stretch and catch it over his left shoulder
length ball, angling into middle stump, worked away to long leg
back of a length outside off, punched firmly to deep point

full, a bit of width, and Raina leans into a crisp drive, times it beautifully, and though Duminy doesn't have too much ground to cover to his right from sweeper cover, and even gets a hand to it after a tumbling dive, he still can't stop the boundary
shortish slower ball on off stump. Raina hops and defends into the covers
short and wide, and Raina cracks it away through backward point with a horizontal bat, third man has no chance of cutting that off
back of a length on off stump. Stops on Raina a touch, and he lets it come on and flicks his wrist to place it to the left of midwicket. Wanted a single, but Dhoni sent him back
bouncer, rising steeply over Raina's left shoulder. Bounces over head height, easily. He simply stands up and watches it go to the leaping AB behind the stumps
back of a length on off stump, defended to extra cover
down the track, slowish, flighted ball outside off, driven to long-off
full-toss wide outside off and Raina stretches out, opens his bat face, and places the drive into the gap at backward point

goes on the back foot to the quicker, flatter ball, and it skids on quickly - wasn't as short as Raina thought either, and he inside-edges it narrowly past the stumps while trying to push it into the off side
a bit of flight on off stump. Raina comes forward and drives firmly, the bowler dives to his right to stop it

googly, and Raina didn't pick it. It was tossed up outside off, and he looked to work it with the turn. Leading edge pops up a touch too high and a touch too far to the left of Faf at short extra cover, bounces down to long-off
down the track and Tahir bowls a flat one at his feet. Dhoni shows it the full face and pushes it down to long-on
shortish outside off. Dhoni plays a firm punch out to deep point
down the track and Albie spots him. Shortens the length and bowls a slower offcutter. Looks to work it leg side, and the ball hits him on the thigh
short ball, pulled - a touch uppishly - down to deep backward square leg

gone! That was wide, not too short, and he went for the big slash outside off. Thick edge, went low to AB, who took it falling forward. Dhoni started walking off immediately, but they're checking if he caught it cleanly. He has, yes.
fullish on middle and off, Axar plays a checked drive to short midwicket
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Axar was looking to work that into the leg side, and sends a leading edge running away to third man
flighted ball on off stump, driven towards point

flighted again, googly this time, driven out to sweeper cover. He may have been looking to hit that straighter - through extra cover or down to long-off, maybe, and the bat turned in his hands a little
another googly, not quite driving length, and Raina goes for the drive, plays a little early, and pops a simple, waist-high catch to Amla at cover
and back he goes, first ball! Another googly from Tahir, slow and enticingly loopy outside off. Harbhajan plays a drive away from his body and the ball sneaks into the gap and pegs back middle stump
And he keeps out the hat-trick ball. Another googly, shorter this time, defended calmly back to the bowler
back of a length, just a bit of width, and even though it goes on straight, Ashwin uses the pace and width to late-cut smartly, nice and fine, into the gap to the left of short third man
fullish on off stump, driven to mid-off
shortish on middle and leg. Axar rides the bounce and tucks it away wide of mid-on
length ball outside off, Ashwin plays the square drive out to point
a bit closer to off stump this time, and Ashwin, opening his bat face to steer it, can't beat the man at backward point
fuller now, on off stump, blocked quietly back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, chopped away down to third man
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
on the pads, flicked away to deep backward square leg
floated up full outside off, and Ashwin gets across to play the lap-sweep out to fine leg
loopy delivery wide outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
tossed up wide of off stump, driven to sweeper cover
short ball, turns in towards middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
loopy slower ball on leg stump, Axar flick-sweeps it out towards deep square leg, and Tahir, sprinting right from long leg, manages to cut it off with the slide
yorker on middle and leg, stabbed out to long-on
back of a length outside off, and Ashwin uses the pace to dab it fine, and Tahir keeps it down to one by getting quickly to his left and bringing out the slide
another! It's a length ball on middle stump, and Axar is a little too early into his flick, hits it in the air, and the man at midwicket takes a fairly simple catch, falling to his left
short outside off, steep bounce, beats the edge as Bhuvneshwar goes for the cut
gone, nine down! Full and straight, not quite full enough for the drive through extra cover, and the ball maybe came in a touch to find the gap between bat and pad and crash into the stumps
back of a length close to off stump, and Ashwin dabs it fine once again. Once again, Tahir is full of energy at third man, chasing full-tilt to his left
length ball angling in and Mohit misses the flick. Lbw appeal from the bowler, but that was probably missing leg stump
length ball on off stump, checked drive to mid-off
full, slips it down the leg side, Ashwin can't connect with the flick
full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
short outside off, slips past Mohit quickly as he tries to lean back and ramp it
looks for the slower ball and it slips out, ends up as a high full-toss that smacks Mohit on the right thigh. It's called no-ball
bouncer outside off, and this one's called wide for height. Mohit looked to back away and make room to uppercut, couldn't make contact
length ball outside off, it's the slower one, and Mohit swishes and misses while giving himself room
short ball, angled in, angled in too far and it slips down the leg side
full on middle stump, looks for the drive towards mid-on and simply doesn't time it, rolls down the pitch off the toe-end of his bat
all over. Ashwin made room to carve over the covers, and Morris bowled a straight length ball. It slipped past his angled bat and hit top of middle
